name: Network of Sustainable Greek Islands
memberOrga: Members of DAFNI currently are the Regions of South and North Aegean and 40 island municipalities: Aegina, Alonissos, Amorgos, Anafi, Andros, Antiparos, Astypalaia, Chios, Fournon-Korseon, Ios, Kea, Kalymnos, Kimolos, Kos, Kythnos, Lipsi, Lefkada, Lesvos, Limnos, Mykonos, Milos, Naxos and small Cyclades, Nisyros, Paros, Patmos, Rhodes, Samothraki, Serifos, Sikinos, Skiathos, Skopelos, Symi, Syros, Sifnos, Skopelos, Thira, Tilos, Tinos, Folegandros and Ydra.
goal:
DAFNI is a network of Greek island local and regional authorities aiming at creating opportunities and supporting initiatives for the sustainable development of the Greek islands. DAFNIâ€™s activities fall within the following key areas:
- Strengthen the role of local authorities for participation in decision making regarding energy planning, protection of the environment and cultural heritage and economic growth
- Exploitation of the potential of renewable energy sources of the islands and promotion of energy saving practices and rational use of energy principles, including public procurement.
- Promotion of new technologies, innovation and entrepreneurship with emphasis on renewable energy, energy efficiency, waste and waste water management and desalination
- Support its members in setting priority sustainability sectors and targets and in being certified through an external certification scheme
- Approach of the regional development through qualitative tourism, social participation and innovative structures
- Participation in European schemes and initiatives for the promotion of the sustainability in islands
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Development, Energy, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Transport
